questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
Which order of steps map a policy to a custom compliance standard?
(Drag the steps into the correct order of occurrence, from the first step to the last.)
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
1. click on compliance standard. 
2. add custom compliance standard. 
3. edit policies.
4. add compliance standard from drop-down menu

The question ask about step mapping policy with Compliance Standard. So I tested on my lab and the correct should like this.
1. Create the custom compliance standard
2. Edit the Policy
3. Click on Compliance Standard
4. Add compliance standard from drop-down menu

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-compliance/create-a-custom-compliance-standard

1) On Prisma Cloud, select Compliance > Standards
2) Create a compliance standard from scratch.
3) Edit policies
4) Add policies to your custom compliance standard.

1. click on compliance standard. **
2. create custom compliance standard. <<<
3. edit policies. < 3rd
4. add compliance standard from drop-down menu

1. click on compliance standard.
2. add custom compliance standard.
3. edit policies.
4. add compliance standard from drop-down menu
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-compliance/create-a-custom-compliance-standard

Correct answer should be: 
1. add custom compliance standard. 
2. edit policies.
3. click on compliance standard. 
4. add compliance standard from drop-down menu

questions.question_text: Which resources can be added in scope while creating a vulnerability policy for continuous integration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Registry images:
Images, Hosts (of the scanner host), Labels, Cloud Account IDs

https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/classic/compute-admin-guide/configure/collections

choices.B: Change the rule options to list both failed and passed checks in the compliance rule edit window.
choices.A: Deploy defenders to scan complete container compliance.
choices.C: Wait until Prisma Cloud finishes the compliance scan and recheck.
choices.D: Change the rule options to list only failed checks in the compliance rule edit window.
To triage alerts and incidents in realtime during deployment
choices.A: To address cloud infrastructure misconfigurations in code before they become alerts or incidents
choices.B: To provide a platform for developers to create custom security policies for applications
choices.C: To offer instant feedback on application performance issues and bottlenecks

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of Prisma Cloud Code Security?

choices.A: It restricts access to all resources and data within the cloud account.
choices.B: It restricts access only to certain types of resources within the cloud account.
choices.D: It does not restrict access to any resources within the cloud account.
choices.C: It restricts access only to the resources and data that pertains to the cloud account(s) within an account group.

questions.question_text: How does assigning an account group to an administrative user on Prisma Cloud help restrict access to resources?
